name: Lisa Gluskin Stonestreet
bio: Lisa Gluskin Stonestreet is the author of The Greenhouse (Bull City Press, 2014), winner of the Frost Place Chapbook Prize; and Tulips, Water, Ash (Northeastern University Press, 2009), winner of the Morse Poetry Prize. Her poems have appeared in journals including Plume, Zyzzyva, The Collagist, Blackbird, and Kenyon Review Online. Stonestreet has been awarded a Javits fellowship and a Phelan Award and has received fellowships from the Millay Colony for the Arts and the Vermont Studio Center. She earned an MFA in poetry from the Warren Wilson MFA Program for Writers. She writes, edits, and teaches in Portland, Oregon, where she is currently working on her third manuscript, Annihilation.
